Sorry if this has been posted, but the few bugs I've found about this were focusing on other aspects (such as the HTML colours not getting colourmanaged).  I also have no knowledge on the matter, so all I can share is an experience.

Ever since I switched to Firefox 4 beta, I've been noticing that some images, apparently all PNG files, appear darker than everything else.  If anything, JPEG thumbnails created from them would appear lighter, and... normal.  Avatars I'd been using for years on sites also appear much darker now with FF4.

It appears that something has changed for the worse since 3.5, but I'm not sure what.  The color_management keys in my Firefox are default.

The linked URL demonstrates the problem well in Firefox 4 beta 11 for me.

Reproducible: Always

Okay, this is weird, FF3.6 might be affected by the FF4 present on the system, so it does the same thing now as FF4 does...  On the other hand, I tried with Opera 10 and Midori (WebKitGTK+ 1.2.0), and found an image that does appear lighter there than in FF, and that lighter appearance is what I remember as being correct.

I'll attach it and also a JPEG version of it converted with `convert avatar-83.png -quality 100 jpeg:avatar-83.jpg`.

I also noticed that on the PNG Gammatest site the sRGB line is not broken in Opera and in Midori, but is broken my Firefoxes.
